summary: This document is a news article excerpt analyzing Jeffrey Epstein's private calendars from 2010-2018, revealing that roughly 20% of his appointments were with young women, often identified only by first names and phone numbers. The schedules were circulated by his executive assistant and show these appointments interspersed with meetings with businesspeople, politicians, and celebrities.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Convicted sex offender, subject of investigation
persons.context: The central figure whose private calendars from 2010-2018 are being analyzed, showing numerous appointments with young women.

persons.name: Lesley Groff
persons.context: Circulated Epstein's daily schedules which listed appointments and flights with young women; her lawyer stated she made appointments as directed and engaged in no misconduct.

persons.name: Jonathan Whitcomb
persons.context: Provided statement defending Groff, stating she made appointments as directed by Epstein and engaged in no misconduct during her employment.

connections.description: Groff was Epstein's executive assistant who circulated his daily schedules and made appointments as directed by him.
Whitcomb is identified as the lawyer representing Lesley Groff, providing a statement on her behalf.

events.title: Epstein's calendar appointments with young women
events.description: Epstein's private calendars from 2010-2018 showed hundreds of appointments and flights with women in their teens or 20s, often identified only by first names and phone numbers, comprising roughly 20% of his meetings.

events.title: Analysis of Epstein's 2015 calendar
events.description: Epstein's schedules in 2015 showed dozens of meetings and flights with young women in their late teens and 20s, often on the same days as meetings with business people, celebrities, and others.

keyFacts: Epstein's private calendars from 2010-2018 showed roughly one in five meetings was with a young woman, often identified only by first name and phone number.
Epstein's executive assistant Lesley Groff circulated the daily schedules that listed these appointments and flights with young women.
Many appointments with young women were scheduled on the same days as Epstein's meetings with businesspeople, politicians, and celebrities.
The Wall Street Journal reviewed the schedules but couldn't identify or reach all the women listed in the documents.
